docs.snippet: John Travolta’s mispronunciation of a name at the Oscars led the website Slate to create a feature to do the same with anyone’s name — the kind of interactive game now driving Web traffic....
docs.lead_paragraph: John Travolta’s mispronunciation of a name at the Oscars led the website Slate to create a feature to do the same with anyone’s name — the kind of interactive game now driving Web traffic.
docs.abstract: News organizations are changing their formats in the digital age to connect with more readers, as quizzes and games emerge as prominent and reliable drivers of web traffic; shift is matter of necessity as it allows organizations to charge higher advertising rates in an increasingly difficult market, but question remains of where to draw line between amusement and core mission of reporting the news.

headline.main: To Spur Traffic at News Sites, Just Travoltify
headline.print_headline: To Spur Traffic at News Sites, Just Travoltify
